augurpy

  • Usage
  • View page source

Usage

API

Import augur as follows:

import augurpy as ag

You can then access the respective modules like: 

ag.function()

Example implementation

import augurpy as ag

adata = '<data_you_want_to_analyse.h5ad>'
adata = ag.load(adata, label_col = "<label_col_name>", cell_type_col = "<cell_type_col_name>")
classifier = ag.create_estimator(classifier='random_forest_classifier')
adata, results = ag.predict(adata, classifier)

# metrics for each cell type
results['summary_metrics']

See here for a more elaborate tutorial.

Loading Data

read_load.load(input[, meta, label_col, ...])

Loads the input data.

Estimator

estimator.create_estimator(classifier[, params])

Creates a model object of the provided type and populates it with desired parameters.

estimator.Params([n_estimators, max_depth, ...])

Type signature for random forest and logistic regression parameters.

Evaluation

evaluate.predict(adata, classifier[, ...])

Calculates the Area under the Curve using the given classifier.

Differential Prioritization

differential_prioritization.predict_differential_prioritization(...)

Predicts the differential prioritization by performing permutation tests on samples.

Plots

pl.differential_prioritization.plot_differential_prioritization(results)

Plot result of differential prioritization.

pl.important_features.important_features(results)

Plot a lollipop plot of the n features with largest feature importances.

pl.lollipop.lollipop(results[, ax, ...])

Plot a lollipop plot of the mean augur values.

pl.scatterplot.scatterplot(results1, results2)

Create scatterplot with two augur results.

pl.umap.umap(adata)

Plot UMAP representation of anndata with augur_score labeling.
